abstract: Nokia faces long road ahead, with losses of $597 million in second and third quarters and nine-month smartphone market share loss of nearly half, to 15.5 percent in September; hopes are high for new smartphones with Microsoft's operating system.
snippet: The road back for Nokia is going to be a long one, but many believe it will begin with the new smartphones bearing Microsoft's operating system to be introduced Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: The road back for Nokia is going to be a long one, but many believe it will begin with the new smartphones bearing Microsoft's operating system to be introduced Wednesday.

headline.main: Crucial Test for Nokia as Latest Smartphones Arrive
headline.print_headline: Nokia, a Fallen Leader, Risks a Lot in Introducing Phones With Windows Software
